Description: Ostracon, fragment from the body of a brown pottery ribbed vessel, interior caked with an unidentified substance, exterior covered with a brown-coloured slip and with remains of six lines of Coptic text written in black ink, very faded in places, and containing part of a letter.
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.92)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (87596) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/87596)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Sarga 98 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
